Notes: c850: Ludolf appointed Margrave of Saxony by Emperor Louis the German961-1106: To House of Billung1106: To Henry the Proud1180: Henry the Lion (House of Welf) deprived of his Duchy of Saxony1180: Separation of the counties of Blankenburg, Cloppenburg, Hohenstein, Lippe, Oldenburg, Ravensberg, Tecklenburg, Duchy of Westphalia, the prince-bishoprics of Bremen, Halberstadt, Hildesheim, Lübeck, Magdeburg, Minden, Münster, Osnabrück, Paderborn, Ratzeburg, Schwerin, and Verden1260: Partitioned into Saxe-Lauenburg and Saxe-Wittenberg, both claiming the electoral dignity
